question: Which country has become the first NATO nation to appoint a female Chief of Armed Forces?
explanation: Slovenia has become the first NATO (North Atlantic Treaty Organization) nation to appoint a female Chief of Armed Forces after Major General Alenka Ermenc took the post of Head of its Army. The country  has approximately 7.500 soldiers, including active and reserve forces.  Slovenia, which originally was part of Yugoslavia, joined NATO and the European Union in 2004. NATO is an international alliance that consists of 29 member states  and 28 EU nations.
